tit.e: "Nanto Moro-Haku" (Several Kinds of "Soboshu" [Monk's Sake] Having The Highest Quality)
tit.cmt: A title should not be this long.

sen.j: 南都諸白（なんともろはく）とは、平安時代中期から室町時代末期にかけて、もっとも上質で高級な日本酒として名声を揺るぎなく保った、奈良（南都）の寺院で諸白でつくられた僧坊酒の総称。
sen.e: "Nanto moro-haku" was the general term for several kinds of "soboshu" (monk's sake) produced with "moro-haku" (the sake brewing method using the polished rice both for the mold-cultivated rice and for the steamed rice) at temples in "Nara" (also called "Nanto" [south capital]), which firmly kept its reputation as the sake of the highest quality & grade from the middle of the Heian period to the end of the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 具体的には菩提山正暦寺が産した『菩提泉（ぼだいせん）』を筆頭として、『山樽（やまだる）』『大和多武峯酒（やまとたふのみねざけ）』などが有名である。
sen.e: The soboshu were, for example, "Bodaisen," which was the most famous sake brewed at Shoryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Bodai, and "Yamadaru"& "Yamato Tahu no Mine zake" were also famous.
"Bodaisen" brewed at Shoryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Bodai was the most famous while "Yamadaru" and "Yamato Tahu no Mine zake" are also well-known.

sen.j: まだ大規模な酒造器具も開発されておらず、台所用品に毛の生えた程度の器具しかなかったと思われるこの時代に、菩提酛、煮酛など高度な知識の集積にもとづいて、かなりの手間を掛け、精緻に洗練された技術で製造していたと思われる。
sen.e: In those days, brewers seem to have owned just the tools hardly better than kitchen utensils, because large implements for brewing sake were not developed yet, but based on high-level knowledge accumulated about "Bodai-moto" (a sake ingredient), "Ni-moto" (a sake producing method) and others, they seem to have produced Nanto moro-haku with considerable efforts and scrupulously refined techniques.

sen.j: 僧坊酒全盛の時代が終わってからも、奈良流の造り酒屋がその製法を引き継ぎ、江戸時代に入ってからもこのブランドで下り酒などの販路に乗せていた。
sen.e: Even after soboshu passed its prime, some sake brewers inherited the brewing method of Nara temples, and these brewers continued to put this brand on the market of "kudarizake" (the sake transported from Kyoto & Osaka area down to Edo) also in the Edo period.
